How infinite sets could work in haskell

published Thu Apr 29 2021| 1 minute read | Written by Euler

Â« Back

I recently found out, very sadly, that haskell does not support infinite sets. I find this unfortunate. Haskell has infinite lists and infinite trees, so why not infinite lists? I don't really know much about how GHC works under the hood, but here I will talk about how infinite sets in haskell could work. Â For example, let us look at the set of all natural numbers N.
